statutoryBodies.name: Sri Lanka Medical Council
statutoryBodies.statusNote: Fully operational. The SLMC is the primary regulatory body for medical, dental, and allied health professionals in Sri Lanka. Operates from Colombo with active registration and disciplinary functions.

exOfficio.role: Heads of Departments, Medical Faculty, University of Colombo

nominated.note: Registered practitioners not in government service

powers: Maintain the Medical Register and Dental Register (Part IV, Sections 23-34A)
Grant provisional and full registration to medical practitioners (Part V)
Register midwives (Part VII), pharmacists (Part VIII), para-medical assistants (Part VIIIA)
Register professions supplementary to medicine (Part VIII AA)
Recognize foreign medical and dental qualifications (Section 22C)
Inquire into professional misconduct and remove practitioners from register (Section 22D-22F)
Make regulations for registration and practice standards (Section 22M)
Approve medical curricula and training programs

amendments.summary: Introduced Part IIIA granting the Medical Council extensive regulatory powers including licensing examinations, recognition of foreign qualifications, and disciplinary procedures.
amendments.details: This was a landmark amendment that transformed the Medical Council from primarily a registration body into a full regulatory authority. Added Sections 22B through 22M covering: licensing examinations (22B), recognition of foreign qualifications (22C), inquiry into professional misconduct (22D-22F), removal from register (22G), appeals (22H-22J), temporary registration (22K), regulations-making power (22M).

amendments.summary: Modified Sri Lanka Medical Council composition, introducing elected member categories for medical practitioners and specialists.
amendments.details: Restructured Section 13 to expand the Council composition with multiple elected categories: 8 elected medical practitioners (non-government), 3 elected medical specialists (government), 1 elected dental specialist, 1 elected practitioner under S.52(2), and 1 elected registered dentist.

amendments.summary: Further modifications to Medical Council composition and election procedures.
amendments.details: Continued refinement of the Council's composition structure established by the 1987 amendment. Modified election eligibility and nomination procedures for council membership.

amendments.summary: Modified provisions relating to registration of medical practitioners.
amendments.details: Amended Part V of the Ordinance dealing with the registration requirements and practice rights of medical practitioners. Specific section-level details require paywall access.

amendments.summary: Administrative and procedural amendments to the Medical Ordinance.
amendments.details: Various administrative modifications. Full details available in the gazette.

amendments.summary: Significant changes to Medical Council governance and regulatory powers.
amendments.details: Major amendment affecting the Medical Council's governance structure (Part III) and regulatory powers (Part IIIA). Strengthened the Council's authority over medical practice standards.

amendments.summary: Amendments to strengthen Medical Council powers and update registration provisions.
amendments.details: Updated provisions relating to the Medical Council's regulatory authority, registration procedures, and disciplinary mechanisms.

amendments.summary: Recent amendments to Medical Council composition and regulatory powers.
amendments.details: Modified provisions relating to the composition of the Medical Council and its regulatory functions under Part IIIA.

amendments.summary: Most recent amendment updating Medical Council structure and functions.
amendments.details: The most recent amendment to the Medical Ordinance, further updating the Council's composition and regulatory framework to meet contemporary healthcare governance needs.
